summary_markdown: This table outlines a shift in brand performance strategy, contrasting a "Past World View" with a "New World View." The core structure is comparative, highlighting divergent approaches across several key areas. In terms of growth, the past focused on "Targeting Brand Loyals," whereas the new view emphasizes "Growth Through Penetration." Brand metrics have evolved from "Unpredictable Confusing Brand Metrics" to "Predictable Meaningful Brand Metrics." The role of price promotions has shifted from winning new customers to engaging "Existing Loyal Customers." Marketing strategies have moved from "Target Marketing" to "Sophisticated Mass Marketing." Competitive approaches have transitioned from "We Compete on Positioning" to "Heuristics," and the concept of "Differentiation" has been redefined as "Distinctiveness."
